Records: Accuser says he found ex-Arlington youth club worker in his bed

One person accusing Paul Collins, 62, of sexual abuse during the late 1970s punched the swim coach in the head after he found the man had climbed into bed with him, court records said. Collins pleaded not guilty today to multiple charges. (2:13 p.m.)

Driver ID'd in crash that killed visiting scientist

Visiting MIT scientist Kanako Miura, 36, who's from Japan, was struck by a truck while riding a bicycle in Boston yesterday. Police said the truck's driver is cooperating with investigators. (11:24 a.m.)
  • Listen Globe editor on hit-and-run crash

Two Powerball winners in N.H. (well, sort of)

It wasn't the $590.5 million jackpot, but two $1 million Powerball tickets were sold in the Granite State. (11:29 a.m.)
  • Fla. town wonders who won the record Powerball jackpot

(Samantha Laine/Your Town Correspondent )

News

Tornadoes slam Plains, Midwest

Several tornadoes struck parts of the nation’s midsection Sunday, concentrating damage in central Oklahoma and Wichita, Kan. Two people were killed and at least 39 were injured.
